attributes.description: If `True`, indicates that when this object was created, `_accuracy_` was recorded as a percent value; if `False`, as an absolute quantity value.
attributes.name: accuracy_is_percent

attributes.description: Accuracy of measurement, expressed either as a half-range percent value (`_accuracy_is_percent_` = `True`) or a half-range quantity. A value of `0` means that accuracy is 100%, i.e. no error.
attributes.name: accuracy

functions.meaning: Test whether a number is a valid percentage, i.e. between 0 and 100.
functions.name: valid_percentage

functions.meaning: Sum of this amount and another. The value of accuracy in the result is either:
functions.name: add

functions.meaning: Difference of this amount and another. The value of `_accuracy_` in the result is either:
functions.name: subtract

functions.meaning: Return True if this `DV_AMOUNT` is considered equal to `_other_`.
functions.name: is_equal

functions.meaning: Negated version of current object, such as used for representing a difference, e.g. a weight loss.
functions.name: negative

functions.meaning: True if this object is less than `_other_`. Based on comparison of `_magnitude_`.
functions.name: less_than

meta_info.description: Abstract class defining the concept of relative quantified  'amounts'. For relative quantities, the  `+` and  `-` operators are defined (unlike descendants of `DV_ABSOLUTE_QUANTITY`, such as the date/time types).
meta_info.name: DV_AMOUNT
